keyMoments.title: Bell-mère's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère appears as a wounded Marine soldier in the Oykot Kingdom, ready to accept death on the battlefield.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Nami's adoptive mother, one of the most beloved parental figures in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: I guess this is it... I'm going to die here.

keyMoments.title: Discovering Nami and Nojiko
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère discovers young Nojiko carrying baby Nami in the ruins. Baby Nami's smile gives her the will to live.
keyMoments.significance: The moment that transforms Bell-mère's life and establishes the family bond that defines Nami's character.
keyMoments.quote: This baby... she's smiling. Even in this hell, she's smiling at me.

keyMoments.title: Adopting the Girls
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère returns to Cocoyasi Village and declares her intention to raise Nami and Nojiko herself, despite community concerns.
keyMoments.significance: Bell-mère's commitment to motherhood despite her troubled past and limited resources.
keyMoments.quote: I'm going to raise these girls myself!

keyMoments.title: Sacrificing for Her Daughters
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère feeds the girls proper meals while eating only mikans herself, claiming to be on a diet to hide their poverty.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Bell-mère's selfless love and sacrifice for her adopted daughters.
keyMoments.quote: I'm on a diet, so I'm just eating mikans!

keyMoments.title: Bell-mère's Philosophy
keyMoments.description: Bell-mère shares her life philosophy with Nojiko, explaining that as long as you survive, happy times will come.
keyMoments.significance: This wisdom becomes a core theme that sustains Nami through years of suffering under Arlong.
keyMoments.quote: If you survive, happy times will come your way.

statusHistory.reason: Shown alive in flashbacks during this episode

abilities.description: Bell-mère was trained as a Marine soldier and demonstrated combat skills during the war.
Bell-mère was proficient with rifles from her time as a Marine.

relationships.description: Bell-mère is Nami's adoptive mother who found her as a baby and raised her with unconditional love.

evolutionMoments.description: Bell-mère discovers baby Nami and decides to adopt her, bringing her to Cocoyasi Village.

relationships.description: Bell-mère is Nojiko's adoptive mother who found her as a young child and raised her as her own daughter.

evolutionMoments.description: Bell-mère discovers young Nojiko carrying baby Nami and decides to adopt both girls.

relationships.description: Genzo is a close friend of Bell-mère and serves as a father figure to her daughters.

evolutionMoments.description: Genzo supports Bell-mère's decision to adopt the girls and helps care for the family.

reveals.information: Former Marine who fought in the Oykot Kingdom war
Adopted Nami and Nojiko after finding them as war orphans
Known as a troublemaker in her youth but became a devoted mother

keyMoments.title: Baby Nami Found in War Zone
keyMoments.description: Revealed that baby Nami was found by Bell-mère in the ruins of the Oykot Kingdom war, being carried by young Nojiko.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals Nami's origins as a war orphan and the moment she first met Bell-mère.

keyMoments.title: Young Nami's Cartography Dream
keyMoments.description: Young Nami expresses her dream to draw a map of the entire world, explaining why she steals cartography books.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the origin of Nami's passion for navigation and map-making.
keyMoments.quote: I want to draw a map of the whole world!

keyMoments.title: Nami's Hurtful Words to Bell-mère
keyMoments.description: In anger over poverty, young Nami tells Bell-mère 'You're not even my real mother!' before running away.
keyMoments.significance: Creates lifelong regret for Nami as these become her last words to Bell-mère before the tragedy.
keyMoments.quote: You're not even my real mother!

relationships.description: Bell-mère is Nami's adoptive mother who raised her from infancy with unconditional love.

evolutionMoments.description: Revealed that Bell-mère found baby Nami in a war zone and adopted her.

relationships.description: Nojiko is Nami's adoptive older sister, both raised together by Bell-mère.

evolutionMoments.description: Flashback shows that Nojiko carried baby Nami through the war zone before Bell-mère found them.

reveals.information: Nami was a war orphan from the Oykot Kingdom conflict
Nami dreamed of mapping the entire world since childhood
Nami used to steal cartography books to pursue her dream due to poverty

keyMoments.title: Nojiko Begins Telling Nami's Past
keyMoments.description: Nojiko decides to reveal the truth about Nami's childhood and suffering to the Straw Hat crew.
keyMoments.significance: Nojiko serves as the narrator for the flashback arc, helping the crew understand Nami.
keyMoments.quote: I'll tell you about Nami's past.

keyMoments.title: Young Nojiko Carrying Baby Nami
keyMoments.description: Revealed that young Nojiko was found carrying baby Nami through a war-torn battlefield before Bell-mère discovered them.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nojiko's protective nature toward her younger sister from the very beginning.

relationships.description: Bell-mère is Nojiko's adoptive mother who found her as a young child and raised her.

evolutionMoments.description: Bell-mère discovers young Nojiko carrying baby Nami and decides to adopt both.

relationships.description: Nami is Nojiko's adoptive younger sister, both raised by Bell-mère.

evolutionMoments.description: Flashback shows young Nojiko carrying and protecting baby Nami during the war.

reveals.information: Nojiko was a war orphan from the Oykot Kingdom conflict
Nojiko protected baby Nami during the war before Bell-mère found them

keyMoments.title: Genzo's Pinwheel Origin
keyMoments.description: Genzo attaches a pinwheel to his hat to make baby Nami laugh, as his stern face would make her cry.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the origin of Genzo's iconic pinwheel and his fatherly love for Nami.

keyMoments.title: Witnessing Arlong's Tribute Announcement
keyMoments.description: Genzo witnesses Arlong announce the brutal tribute system to the village.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Genzo's helplessness in protecting his village from Arlong's tyranny.

relationships.description: Close friend of Bell-mère who supported her decision to adopt Nami and Nojiko.

evolutionMoments.description: Genzo helps Bell-mère with the girls and becomes a father figure to them.

relationships.description: Genzo serves as a father figure to Nami, caring for her since infancy.

evolutionMoments.description: Genzo attaches a pinwheel to his hat to make baby Nami laugh, showing his affection.

reveals.information: Genzo's stern face would make baby Nami cry, so he wore a pinwheel to make her laugh

keyMoments.title: Arlong Arrives at Cocoyasi Village (Flashback)
keyMoments.description: In the flashback, Arlong and his crew arrive at Cocoyasi Village for the first time and declare it their territory.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the beginning of 8 years of tyranny that shapes Nami's entire life.
keyMoments.quote: This island now belongs to the Arlong Pirates!

keyMoments.title: Arlong Announces Tribute System
keyMoments.description: Arlong declares his brutal tribute system: 100,000 berries per adult, 50,000 per child, or death.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the oppressive system that enslaves the entire village for years.
keyMoments.quote: Adults pay 100,000 berries. Children pay 50,000 berries. Those who cannot pay... will die!

bounties.reason: Highest bounty in the East Blue

reveals.information: Arlong establishes dominion over Cocoyasi Village through his tribute system

keyMoments.title: Mummy Mee Tries to Convince Bell-mère
keyMoments.description: Mummy Mee, a houseparent of a World Government orphanage, tries to convince Bell-mère to give Nami and Nojiko to their facility.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the community's doubt in Bell-mère's ability to raise children.

relationships.description: Co-houseparent at the World Government orphanage.

keyMoments.title: Daddy Dee Tries to Convince Bell-mère
keyMoments.description: Daddy Dee, a houseparent of a World Government orphanage, tries to convince Bell-mère to give Nami and Nojiko to their facility.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the community's doubt in Bell-mère's ability to raise children.

relationships.description: Co-houseparent at the World Government orphanage.
